title: ICE: Broken MIR with feature `generic_const_exprs`

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
### Code To reproduce this error, please clone [this repo](https://github.com/znx3p0/sia/tree/bc0145aae8f9dccf818ea6aaa1ef8f5c17baf3e8) and build it. ### Meta `rustc --version --verbose`: ``` rustc 1.59.0-nightly (5531927e8 2021-12-16) binary: rustc commit-hash: 5531927e8af9b99ad923af4c827c91038bca51ee commit-date: 2021-12-16 host: x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu release: 1.59.0-nightly LLVM version: 13.0.0 ``` ### Error output ``` error: internal compiler error: compiler/rustc_mir_transform/src/generator.rs:753:13: Broken MIR: generator contains type [u8; 8] in MIR, but typeck only knows about {ResumeTy, &mut Snow, O, Vec, usize, Snow, &mut T, T, &Vec, u64, [u8; _], &[u8], &[u8; _], async_std::io::write::write::WriteFuture, (), async_std::io::write::flush::FlushFuture} and [&mut async_snow::Snow, O] --> igcp/src/async_snow.rs:141:71 | 141 | pub async fn tx(&mut self, obj: O) -> Result { | _______________________________________________________________________^ 142 | | // serialize or return invalid data error 143 | | let vec = bincode::serialize(&obj).or_else(|e| err!((invalid_data, e)))?; 144 | | // get length from serialized object ... | 158 | | Ok(res) 159 | | } | |_____^ ```
Backtrace

``` thread 'rustc' panicked at 'Box', /rustc/5531927e8af9b99ad923af4c827c91038bca51ee/compiler/rustc_errors/src/lib.rs:1115:9 stack backtrace: 0: std::panicking::begin_panic:: 1: std::panic::panic_any:: 2: ::span_bug:: 3: ::span_bug:: 4: rustc_middle::ty::context::tls::with_opt::::{closure#0}, ()> 5: rustc_middle::util::bug::opt_span_bug_fmt:: 6: rustc_middle::util::bug::span_bug_fmt:: 7: ::run_pass 8: rustc_mir_transform::pass_manager::run_passes 9: rustc_mir_transform::optimized_mir 10: >::with_task:: 11: rustc_data_structures::stack::ensure_sufficient_stack::<(&rustc_middle::mir::Body, rustc_query_system::dep_graph::graph::DepNodeIndex), rustc_query_system::query::plumbing::execute_job::{closure#3}> 12: rustc_query_system::query::plumbing::try_execute_query::> 13: ::optimized_mir 14: ::generator_layout 15: >::layout_of_uncached 16: rustc_middle::ty::layout::layout_of 17: >::with_task::, core::result::Result, rustc_middle::ty::layout::LayoutError>> 18: rustc_query_system::query::plumbing::get_query:: 19: ::layout_of 20: > as alloc::vec::spec_from_iter::SpecFromIter, core::iter::adapters::ResultShunt, >::layout_of_uncached::{closure#5}::{closure#0}>, rustc_middle::ty::layout::LayoutError>>>::from_iter 21: >> as alloc::vec::spec_from_iter::SpecFromIter>, core::iter::adapters::ResultShunt, >::layout_of_uncached::{closure#5}>, rustc_middle::ty::layout::LayoutError>>>::from_iter 22: >::layout_of_uncached 23: rustc_middle::ty::layout::layout_of 24: >::with_task::, core::result::Result, rustc_middle::ty::layout::LayoutError>> 25: rustc_query_system::query::plumbing::get_query:: 26: ::layout_of 27: rustc_middle::ty::layout::layout_of 28: >::with_task::, core::result::Result, rustc_middle::ty::layout::LayoutError>> 29: rustc_query_system::query::plumbing::get_query:: 30: ::layout_of 31: ::run_pass 32: rustc_mir_transform::pass_manager::run_passes 33: rustc_mir_transform::optimized_mir 34: >::with_task:: 35: rustc_data_structures::stack::ensure_sufficient_stack::<(&rustc_middle::mir::Body, rustc_query_system::dep_graph::graph::DepNodeIndex), rustc_query_system::query::plumbing::execute_job::{closure#3}> 36: rustc_query_system::query::plumbing::try_execute_query::> 37: ::optimized_mir 38: ::encode_crate_root 39: rustc_metadata::rmeta::encoder::encode_metadata_impl 40: rustc_data_structures::sync::join:: 41: rustc_metadata::rmeta::encoder::encode_metadata 42: ::ongoing_codegen 43: ::enter::, rustc_errors::ErrorReported>> 44: rustc_span::with_source_map::, rustc_interface::interface::create_compiler_and_run, rustc_driver::run_compiler::{closure#1}>::{closure#1}> 45: >::set::, rustc_driver::run_compiler::{closure#1}>::{closure#0}, core::result::Result<(), rustc_errors::ErrorReported>>::{closure#0}::{closure#0}, core::result::Result<(), rustc_errors::ErrorReported>> note: Some details are omitted, run with `RUST_BACKTRACE=full` for a verbose backtrace. note: the compiler unexpectedly panicked. this is a bug. note: we would appreciate a bug report: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/new?labels=C-bug%2C+I-ICE%2C+T-compiler&template=ice.md note: rustc 1.59.0-nightly (5531927e8 2021-12-16) running on x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu note: compiler flags: -C embed-bitcode=no -C debuginfo=2 -C incremental --crate-type lib note: some of the compiler flags provided by cargo are hidden query stack during panic: #0 [optimized_mir] optimizing MIR for `async_snow::::tx::{closure#0}` #1 [layout_of] computing layout of `[static generator@igcp/src/async_snow.rs:141:71: 159:6]` #2 [layout_of] computing layout of `core::future::from_generator::GenFuture<[static generator@igcp/src/async_snow.rs:141:71: 159:6]>` #3 [layout_of] computing layout of `impl core::future::future::Future` #4 [optimized_mir] optimizing MIR for `async_snow::::tx` end of query stack ```
